sentences.sContent: ...Some people insist that social networking websites provide large collections of information at great speed and stimulate our reading interest...
...It could also insist on checking private manned spacecraft as thoroughly as it does commercial aircraft...
...most American universities insist that students sample natural and social sciences...
...They insist that their conclusions are "measurable and actionable" — guides to behaviour rather than analysis for its own sake...

phrases.pCn: 坚持，坚决要求；督促，强调

remMethod.val: in(里面) ＋ sist(站) → 一直站在里面 → 坚持

words.tran: 坚持的；迫切的；显著的；引人注目的；紧急的
坚持；显著或紧急之事；强迫；强调

trans.tranCn: 坚持； 坚持要求； 坚决认为
trans.tranOther: to say firmly and often that something is true, especially when other people think it may not be true
